text: examined and testified as follows:
-  -  - EXAMINATION
Ms. Belz, where do you live?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I live 151 Canterbury.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And that's -- how long have you lived there?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Since 2003, November 2003.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you still employed at University Otolaryngol -- I can never say it -- Associates?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you very much.  We're here, of course, because of a crash that happened back on...
speaker: MR. BAER

text: May 4th, 2017.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Thank you very much.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Do you remember being involved in a motor vehicle accident on that date?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did it happen?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: On County Line Road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was the -- what was the cross street?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: It was in between Stump and 202.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what were you driving at the time, what type of vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: A Kia Sorento.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you still own that vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any passengers in the vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how many passengers -- how many passengers did you have?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: One.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was the identify of that passenger?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: My son.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And your son's name and age at the time that this crash happened?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Colin Zwislewski.  His age -- if it was May of '17, he was 8.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was Colin and the --
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Oh.  I'm sorry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sorry?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I'm sorry.  He was 9.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Nine years old at the time, okay.  And how old is he today?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: He is almost 12.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where were you coming from?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Montgomery Elementary.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did the crash happen?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: It was -- it was -- I was picking him up after work.  I don't know the exact time.  I would say around 5:30-ish, but I don't know exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where was Colin -- your -- I should be more formal.  Where was your son seated in the vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: He was in the passenger seat.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Front passenger seat?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Front passenger seat.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And based on some of the information that your attorney has already provided with me, it's my understanding that you were very familiar with this area; is that correct?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That you had traveled it most -- nearly daily; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Tell us what happened.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: We were stopped at the light, and the light changed.  And we're starting to move forward, and I looked at my son.  He said something.  I looked back and hit the brake but hit her.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: With respect to being stopped at the light, there's a traffic light controlling an intersection of 202, which is the road you were on; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: 202 was the cross traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The cross traffic?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.  I was on County Line Road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: County Line Road.  What were the traffic conditions like on that road, at that light, at or near the time of the crash?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I don't -- don't recall any bad conditions. I don't think it was raining.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The traffic conditions?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Oh, traffic.  I mean it was heavy traffic for that time.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: With respect to the -- with respect to this intersection, if you had not been involved in the crash, you would have made a left-hand turn; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You would have made a right-hand turn?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.  I would have gone straight.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Gone straight.  How many lanes of travel are there for your direction at that --
speaker: MR. BAER

text: For going straight?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- at that intersection?  All the -- all the lanes.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: It's three or four.  I know that there's a left turn lane.  I'm not positive if there's a right turn lane. Definitely three, at least.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And which of the three lanes that you can recall were you in?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I was in the second -- the left straight lane.  I was not in the turn lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long had you been stopped at that intersection before the light turned green and you observed vehicles beginning to travel forward?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't know exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: With respect to traffic generally -- traffic specifically, can you remember how many cars back you were from the light when the light turned green?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember as to whether or not you had to wait through the cycle of another traffic light before getting to where you were when the light turned green before this crash?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I'm sorry.  Say that again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you in a line of traffic?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I was in a line of traffic.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far back were you from the light?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it more than three cars back from the light?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, you indicated that the light turned green and cars began to go; is that correct?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you began to travel forward; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You indicated that your said -- son said something to you; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what the conversation was?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what your son's emotional state was when he was asking you something?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know how fast you were going when your son turned your -- called your attention and you began to speak to him?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.  We had just started to move.  It was slow.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any way of quantifying what "slow" means?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean it was -- we were just like rolling forward. When, you know, you initially start, you -- I mean it was slow.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Your Kia Sorento, was it equipped with an automatic transmission?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was your foot on the gas, the accelerator, when -- when you began to move forward, or did it -- or did it just roll after taking your foot off the brake, or something else?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Specifically, I can't remember.  I mean, you know, at some point, I -- I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do -- can you estimate how far away the front of your vehicle was from the rear of my client's vehicle when you were first stopped at the -- at the -- at the traffic light?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you estimate how far you were away from the back of my client's vehicle when you looked up and saw that my client's vehicle had stopped?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I know that I was close, because I, you know, jammed on my brake, but I don't know space-wise.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Space-wise, was it more than a car length?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it less than a car length?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it less than ten feet?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You just testified that you slammed on the brakes; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was your foot that -- and I'm assuming that you used your right foot to slam on the brakes?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was your right foot before you slammed on the brakes?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I -- I don't remember specifically.  I remember looking back, seeing her car, and just hitting the brake.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you have no memory as to what you were -- what your foot was doing --
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I don't know if my foot -- no.  I don't know if my foot was like hovering over the gas.  I don't know if I was on the gas.  I -- you know, it was -- you know, it just -- everything was just sort of like easing forward.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you able to ascertain why the vehicle in front of you had come to a stop?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the color of the traffic light in front of you, if you know, when my client's vehicle came to a stop?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I believe it was still green.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you have any way of estimating how close you were to the actual intersection when my client's vehicle came to a stop?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I do not recall, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was my client's vehicle -- well, let me show you something here.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I'm gonna mark this document -- I'm not gonna mark it yet.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Did you have an opportunity to observe the type of vehicle that your vehicle came in contact with?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: When?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After the crash.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I saw the car in front of me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you get a look at what happened to the back of that car as a result of the impact that was between your car and that car?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I -- yeah, I saw what the back of the car looked like.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm gonna show you a document.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: And we'll mark it as Exhibit 1 -- Belz-1.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: (Exhibit Belz-1 marked for identification.)
Do you recognize what I am showing you right there?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's a "yes" for the record?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.  Sorry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is that?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: It's the back of her car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that an accurate depiction of what her car looked like after your vehicle came in contact with the back of her vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: As best I can recall, yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is this an accurate depiction as to where her vehicle was immediately following the impact between your vehicle and her vehicle, as it is like in the roadway and the like?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's a "yes"?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.  Sorry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Now, I am not familiar with this intersection, at least not as -- as familiar as -- as you are from -- can you tell me how far these overhead traffic signs are from the actual intersection?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No, I cannot.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that at the corner?  Does -- does that sign and -- and -- and this -- this pole, is that situated at the corner of the intersection or back from the corner of the intersection?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I would be guessing.  I don't know --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: -- for sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would you agree that the -- that your -- the front of your car caused this damage?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I hit the back of her car.  I don't know if she had damage before, but I know that I hit the back of her car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you observe there being any damage in the back of the car that was in front of you before this crash?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I did not.  I did not take any notice.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Did you take any photographs of the other vehicle?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have those photographs?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Not on me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you produced those photographs to your attorney?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I gave them either to my attorney or to the insurance company.  I don't recall which.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Didn't you get discovery answers from us?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: I got discovery answers.  I did not get documents, oddly enough.  I mean I got your -- I got responses to request production documents.  I'll be -- I'll be blunt and say that the way it reads on our -- on our file, it may have been corrupted.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yeah.  We definitely gave them.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Okay.  We'll follow up.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: All right.  Number one, your -- your Kia Sorento, did it sustain any damage?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the vehicle that -- that you own, this Sorento, is it an SUV?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yeah, like a small SUV.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you know what part of your SUV came in the -- came in contact with the -- the back of my client's car?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I would assume it was the bumper.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Did you speak to any of the occupants of this silver car?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And who did you speak to?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I spoke to Ms. Meredith, and, you know, I may have said something to her daughter.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where there any more than two people in the car, that you can recall?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  And what did you say to Ms. Meredith?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Exactly, I don't know.  I mean, you know, "Are you okay?"  But I don't really remember specifically.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there any discussion as to -- any discussion as to how this accident happened?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you apologize to Ms. Meredith?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: "Yes"?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did Ms. Meredith say to you, if anything?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't recall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was Ms. Meredith's demeanor or behavioral response to you?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I mean I remember that she responded.  It wasn't angry or -- you know, just conversation but brief.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the two vehicles remain where the crash happened for a period of time, or did the two of you pull off to the side?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.  We stayed there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long did you stay there?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Until the police arrived.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who called the police, if you know?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't recall.  I don't know.  I may have.  More than one person may have.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You -- you spoke to the police officer or officers that came to the scene, correct?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, an official report of this accident reads that you were cited for distracted driving.  Are you aware of that?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever get a ticket for this incident?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't think so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ask whether or not Ms. Meredith was injured?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I may have.  I don't recall exactly what we discussed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did Ms. Meredith tell you at any point in time that she was, indeed, injured?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have an opportunity to hear Ms. Meredith speak to any of the responding police officers?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes, or some of it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you hear?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: The officer was asking if everybody was okay, and then, you know, were the cars drivable, you know, and did we need an ambulance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what was your response to those questions?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes, we were okay.  And no, we didn't need an ambulance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about Ms. Meredith?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: She said she was okay but she wanted an ambulance. I mean the officer said, "Are you okay?"  She said, "Yes." Like he went to all four of us.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Ms. Meredith, all the same, said that she would like to have an ambulance; is that accurate?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did an ambulance come?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: If it did, it was after I left.  The police dismissed me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Are you aware of there being any witnesses to this crash other than yourself and possibly your son?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you been contacted by anybody, after the fact, indicating that they were a witness to this incident?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever provide a recorded statement to your insurance carrier or any other insurance carrier, investigator, et cetera about how this took place?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't remember if I did.  I don't think so, but I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  With respect to the happening of this accident, do you have any medical restrictions with respect to your driving?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any history of syncope or fainting or anything of that nature?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever been involved in any other car crashes of this type in nature wherein the back of -- the front of your vehicle came into the back of another vehicle --
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- before this crash?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about after?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is it your testimony that you were -- well, it's not -- you were permitted to go by the officer, correct?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were -- you don't remember being given a paper ticket or a paper citation?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you don't remember receiving one in the mail or anything like that?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  If I may, was there anything about the operation of Ms. Meredith's vehicle that you think contributed to the cause of this crash?
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Not that I noticed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's all the questions I have. Thank you.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: All right.  Thank you.  What -- did you mark that?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yes, I did.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: What was it?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: This is -- this is Belz-1.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: Belz-1, all right.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yeah.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: I'm gonna show you Belz-2.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that a picture of your car?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that the car that was involved in the accident?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that how your car looked like after the accident?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's a fair and accurate depiction of what your vehicle looked like after this accident?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was there any damage to the front of your vehicle?
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: I mean maybe a scratch on the bumper, but not -- no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.  That's it.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Thank you.  Or you know what?  I just, really quickly -- that's all right.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: All right.  Thanks.
speaker: MR. SILLI

text: Thank you very much.
speaker: MR. BAER

text: (Exhibit Belz-2 marked for identification.)
(Witness excused.)

(Deposition ended 10:31 a.m.) C E R T I F I C A T I O N I, Ian Monahan, Court Reporter and Notary Public of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, certify that the foregoing is a true and accurate transcript of the foregoing deposition, that the witness was first sworn by me at the time, place and on the date herein before set forth. I further certify that I am neither attorney nor counsel for, not related to nor employed by any of the parties to the action in which this deposition was taken; further, that I am not a relative or employee of any attorney or counsel employed in this case, nor am I financially interested in this action.
